org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class AlphabetAbstraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AlphabetAbstraction

  • public class AlphabetAbstraction
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a method to abstract the alphabet of an automaton that has
    • a propositional alphabet,
    • labels on transitions, and
    • an acceptance condition on states.
    The original propositions of the automaton will be replaced by new propositions defined as predicates of the original propositions. For example, if the alphabet of the automaton is formed by the atomic propositions {p, q}, the symbol on some transition is "p q", and a new proposition r is defined as p ∧ q. Then, after the alphabet abstraction, the alphabet of the automaton will become {"r", "¬ r"} and the symbol on the transition will become "r".
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      • setAnnotationOnly

        public void setAnnotationOnly(boolean b)
        Sets true to make this abstraction only annotate transitions with the evaluation of the predicates. The name of the annotation can be set by setPredicateAnnotation(String).
        Parameters:
        b - true to only annotate transitions with the evaluation of the predicates

      • abs

        public void abs(Automaton aut,
                java.util.Map<Proposition,PL> map)
        Abstracts the alphabet of a specified automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton that has a propositional alphabet, labels on transitions, and an acceptance condition on states
        map - a map from a proposition not in the automaton to a predicate of the propositions in the automaton
